Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<org.bukkit.entity.Player>, Collection<org.bukkit.entity.Player>, List<org.bukkit.entity.Player>, RandomAccess
public class PlayerLobby
extends ArrayList<org.bukkit.entity.Player>
implements List<org.bukkit.entity.Player>

Represents a collection of players.

Constructor Detail

PlayerLobby

public PlayerLobby()
Creates a new PlayerLobby instance.

This is a shorthand for PlayerLobby(false)

See Also:
PlayerLobby(boolean)

PlayerLobby

public PlayerLobby(boolean dynamic)
Creates a new PlayerLobby instance.

Passing true as the argument will result in a dynamic lobby. A dynamic lobby has all the features a regular player lobby has with exception that the players in the lobby are always all online players. Attempts to add or remove players will fail in that case.

Parameters:
dynamic - Whenever to make the lobby dynamic.

remove

public boolean remove(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from this list, if it is present.

If the list does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the element with the lowest index i such that (o==null ? get(i)==null : o.equals(get(i))) (if such an element exists). Returns true if this list contained the specified element (or equivalently, if this list changed as a result of the call).

Parameters:
player - - element to be removed from this list, if present
Returns:
true if this list contained the specified element

contains

public boolean contains(String playerName)
Validates if a player with a certain player-name is in the lobby.

NoteThis validation is case-insensitive.

Parameters:
playerName - The player-name to match.
Returns:
True if the player exists in the lobby.

public boolean isDynamic()

Returns:

See Also:
PlayerLobby(boolean)

getMessageFormat

public String getMessageFormat()
Returns the raw message format.

The message format is a single string representing how messages from message(String) should be formatted. When message() gets called, all occurrences of the underscore character will be replaced by the message. The default message format is _.

Returns:
The message format.

setMessageFormat

public void setMessageFormat(String messageFormat)
Sets the raw message format.

Note: See getMessageFormat() for more information.

Parameters:
messageFormat -
See Also:
getMessageFormat()

message

public void message(String message)
Messages all players in the lobby.

Note: If a custom message format has been set, that will be used to display the message.

Parameters:
message - The message to display.
